newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ First, Labour resume coalition talks.
newsitem.headline: NZ First, Labour resume coalition talks.

text.p: The main opposition Labour Party and nationalist New Zealand party on Tuesday met for their second round of negotiations aimed at forming a new government.
Heading into the 5 p.m. meeting NZ First leader Winston Peters would say only that he did not know how long it would take, but it could last two or three hours.

Labour took a full negotiating team into the meeting. It consisted of leader Helen Clark, policy advisor Heather Simpson, party president Michael Hirschfeld, Maori vice president Dover Samuels, former Labour leader Mike Moore, chief whip Jonathan Hunt, finance spokesman Michael Cullen, and Labour number three
On Wednesday, NZ First will meet with National at 10 a.m. and with Labour at 2 p.m.
Thursday's schedule is similar, with National meeting with NZ First at 10 a.m. and Labour negotiations starting at 2 p.m.
All meetings will be at held at Parliament.
